title: CUDA matmul gives less good error message than CPU matmul
body_html:
(/home/ezyang/Dev/pytorch-env) [ezyang@devgpu005.ash6 ~/Dev/pytorch] python corrupt.py 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "corrupt.py", line 40, in <module>
    y = m(x)
  File "/data/users/ezyang/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 357, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "corrupt.py", line 36, in forward
    x = self.linear(x)
  File "/data/users/ezyang/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 357, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/data/users/ezyang/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/linear.py", line 55, in forward
    return F.linear(input, self.weight, self.bias)
  File "/data/users/ezyang/pytorch/torch/nn/functional.py", line 968, in linear
    output = input.matmul(weight.t())
RuntimeError: size mismatch at /home/ezyang/Dev/pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathBlas.cu:247
(/home/ezyang/Dev/pytorch-env) [ezyang@devgpu005.ash6 ~/Dev/pytorch] fg
vim corrupt.py

[2]+  Stopped                 vim corrupt.py
(/home/ezyang/Dev/pytorch-env) [ezyang@devgpu005.ash6 ~/Dev/pytorch] python corrupt.py 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "corrupt.py", line 40, in <module>
    y = m(x)
  File "/data/users/ezyang/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 357, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "corrupt.py", line 36, in forward
    x = self.linear(x)
  File "/data/users/ezyang/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 357, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/data/users/ezyang/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/linear.py", line 55, in forward
    return F.linear(input, self.weight, self.bias)
  File "/data/users/ezyang/pytorch/torch/nn/functional.py", line 968, in linear
    output = input.matmul(weight.t())
RuntimeError: size mismatch, m1: [1 x 64], m2: [36 x 10] at /home/ezyang/Dev/pytorch/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c:1949
